page.title: 20Attitudes to Village Life
page.content: This survey was made by the children of All Saints' Primary School. They asked why people liked living in this area? It was obvious that everyone enjoyed the peace and quiet of a small community rather than the bustle of town life. Being only 7 miles from Burton upon Trent and convenient for roads to larger towns and cities was seen to be an advantage. Many of the necessary amenities were available. The facilities lacking included social activities for teenagers, a village hall, and tennis courts. Some would like street lights, but others would not. The majority of children like the country life too, being able to play in the fields and on the farms, particularly with the animals, but they would prefer more children to play with, and more local shops.
